gcci.text: The H100 spot price at $3.17/hr suggests supply constraints are easing, but geopolitical tensions and capex investments in domestic fabs could drive volatility in Q4 procurement cycles.

gtpi.text: Input pricing at $1.25/1M tokens reflects aggressive market consolidation, with smaller providers likely struggling to match margins while pushing efficiency innovations to remain competitive.

gagl.text: AI infrastructure consumption of 120 TWh annually represents 5% of U.S. electricity demand, accelerating grid modernization needs and making nuclear power partnerships increasingly strategic for hyperscalers.

aipi.text: While H100 pricing normalizes and token costs decline, the 120 TWh energy appetite suggests unsustainable growth without breakthrough efficiency gains, potentially triggering regulatory intervention before 2026.
